intro: Dorstenia tropaeolifolia, commonly known as the "Mexican velvetleaf," is a member of the family Malvaceae, characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant is native to Central America and features a scrambling growth habit with hairy stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage.
